p: Biodegradable materials based on pectin, pectin-oleate, pectin-linoleate, and pectin palmitate were observed due to the antimicrobial effect against a number of bacterial strains, including S. aureus and E. coli. Pectin-linoleate and pectin-oleate demonstrated great capacity to suppress the growth of the selected microorganisms by 50â€“70%. They have the best antimicrobial activity against S. aureus. Water resistance and the protective properties of the polysaccharide were increased by chemically modified pectin, thus generating and deriving a bio-based material for new applications, such as for instance the safe way to package active food products [ 48].
